channel.title: Help with making a client, got so far and then i get this
channel.description:
[img]http://i58.photobucket.com/albums/g268/gman035t2/help.jpg[/img]
Well basically I never got this error before while executing my .jar file. Until I started including cache files and class files into my .jar
Maybe I am not supposed to add the client.class file? or client.java file?
Because normally I was just able to make "client" the main class, but now its not working. Whats wrong?

item.title: Help with making a client, got so far and then i get this
item.dc:creator: @gman035t gman035t
item.description:
@gman035t wrote:

My problem is this main class thing
My jar file can’t find the main class. Please help.[br][size=1]Posted on: August 29, 2007, 01:02:47 PM[/size][hr]Exactly what is the main class?
I have tried it with just “client” and it doesn’t work either.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with making a client, got so far and then i get this

item.title: Help with making a client, got so far and then i get this
item.dc:creator: @zilchuary zilchuary
item.description:
@zilchuary wrote:

[quote=“Peter787, post:2, topic:138072”]kk bud

Edit your .Bat file, erase everything you have and add this…

@echo off color 0c title Client echo Starting the 1337scape... JAVA -Xmx500m -jar 1337scape.jar client pause[br][size=1]Posted on: August 28, 2007, 07:20:10 PM[/size][hr]change the 1337scape to whatever your .JAR is called…[/quote]
your trying to do somthing wright that wont work lol!

Read full topic
item.source: Help with making a client, got so far and then i get this

item.title: Help with making a client, got so far and then i get this
item.dc:creator: @gman035t gman035t
item.description:
@gman035t wrote:

I know, when I change it to just client it doesn’t find the main class either…
So I am assuming the batch always seeks for a JAVA file?

Read full topic

item.title: Help with making a client, got so far and then i get this
